result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsaye L. Salazar

records.addlTxt:
2:48 PM Defendant Lindsaye L. Salazar in court.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  DE provides written waiver of counsel/plea questionaire.  Court questions DE on her waiver of counsel/accepts.  State states the joint recommendation re: amending matter to county ordinance if DE completes anger management assessment.  DE would like more time to do that - she's still trying to find a facility that can help her.  Bond continued.
Return date scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on January 19, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Lindsaye L. Salazar in court.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney, waived today only.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $150.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Booking.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
